en: My name is Jerry Grey.
zh: 傑瑞我的名字是傑瑞·格雷。

en: I’m a crime writer, I’m a killer, I’m a deeply flawed individual.
zh: 我是一個犯罪小說家，我是一個殺人兇手，我是一個有缺陷的人。

en: There are so many things I want to say.
zh: 我有很多事情想說。

en: First and foremost, I want to apologize to my family.
zh: 首先，我想向我的家人道歉。

en: I wish I could tell Sandra how sorry I am, but what’s done is done, it was done by me, and there’s no going back.
zh: 我希望能告訴桑德拉我很抱歉，但覆水難收，是我做的，沒有後悔葯可吃。

en: I shot you, Sandra, because you found out what kind of man I really am.
zh: 我槍殺了你，桑德拉，因為你發現了真實的我是什麼樣的人。

en: The truth is, my entire life I have had needs I’ve been able to keep in check, only occasionally letting my true self out to play, hurting women on those occasions.
zh: 其實我的生活很壓抑，只是偶爾讓真實的自我出來放縱一下，傷害了那些女人。

en: But when the Alzheimer’s came along, it wiped my impulse control.
zh: 但是，當阿爾茨海默病來襲時，它消除了我的衝動。

en: Those women over the last few weeks, they didn’t die at my hands.
zh: 在過去幾個星期里，那些女人並非死於我手。

en: Eric murdered them and there is enough evidence at his house to prove that.
zh: 是艾瑞克殺死了她們，他家裡有足夠的證據可以證明。

en: I killed him, and in a way I hope it helps balance the scales for the others.
zh: 我殺了他，在某種程度上，我希望這可以將功贖罪。

en: Last year, on the night of Eva’s wedding, I snuck out of my house and I walked to Belinda Murray’s house.
zh: 去年，在伊娃的婚禮之夜，我從家裡溜走了，來到貝琳達·穆雷家。

en: From the moment I first saw her I became infatuated.
zh: 從我第一次見到她的那一刻起，我就迷戀上了她。

en: Something that made me feel alive. I walked to her house, and I picked the lock on her back door.
zh: 我走到她家，撬開後門的鎖。

en: Picking locks and covering up crime scenes, these are things I’ve learned from reading and research and writing.
zh: 撬開門鎖和掩蓋犯罪現場，這些都是從閱讀、研究和寫作中學到的。

en: But I don’t want to cover up crime scenes anymore.
zh: 但是，我不想掩蓋犯罪現場了。

en: I just want the world to know what happened because I’m tired of lying, and soon I won’t be able to lie anyway.
zh: 我想讓全世界都知道發生了什麼，因為我厭倦了說謊，而且很快我就不能說謊了。

en: I killed Belinda Murray because I wanted to, because I knew it would feel good, and it did.
zh: 我殺了貝琳達·穆雷，因為那就是我想要的，我知道那感覺很好，真的很好。

en: I’ve come back to the place where it all started.
zh: 我回到了一切開始的地方。

en: It’s here where I raised Eva, had a life with Sandra, it’s here where the books were written, where Sandra died, and where I will die.
zh: 我在這裏養育了伊娃，與桑德拉共同生活，在這裏寫書，在這裏桑德拉死了，我也會死去。

en: I’ve come back to look for my Madness Journal, but it isn’t here, and I remember now, I remember destroying it after I killed Sandra.
zh: 我回來尋找我的「狂人日記」，但它不在這裏，我記得發生過的事情，殺了桑德拉后我把它給毀了。

en: I had confessed in there what I had done, so I tore out the pages and I tore them into shreds and I flushed them away.
zh: 我在日記里承認我犯下的罪行，所以我撕掉那幾頁，撕成碎片，我用水把它們沖走了。

en: Now I’m more clearheaded than I’ve been in a long time.
zh: 現在我的頭腦比以往任何時候都清醒。

en: This isn’t just a confession. This is also my suicide note.
zh: 這不只是一個懺悔書，這也是我的遺書。

en: I’m not killing myself because I’m a bad man. I’m not killing myself because I’m a monster.
zh: 我自殺不是因為我是個壞人，我自殺不是因為我是一個怪物。

en: I’m killing myself because I’m already forgetting the people I’ve hurt.
zh: 我自殺是因為我已經忘記了我傷害的那些人。

en: The fantasy, thinking about Belinda, about shooting Sandra, that’s what gets me through the days. Without those thoughts, I have nothing.
zh: 想想貝琳達，想想桑德拉，這就是我這些日子的所思所想，若是沒有了這些想法，我將一無所有。

en: I would rather die than forget how it feels to kill.
zh: 我寧願死也不願忘記殺人是什麼感覺。

en: Hans grabs them and sits back on the couch. He reads through it, glancing up every few seconds to make sure Jerry isn’t making a break for it. When he’s done he moves back to the desk and hands the pages back.
zh: 傑瑞把懺悔書推到辦公桌另一邊，漢斯一把抓在手裡，坐在沙發上，立刻開始讀了起來，每隔幾秒鐘他抬頭看一眼，確保傑瑞不會逃走。

en: “You can do better,” Hans says.
zh: 「你可以寫得更好。」漢斯說。

en: “It’s good enough,” Jerry says.
zh: 「這就夠好了。」傑瑞說。

en: “You don’t even apologize to your family. You don’t tell them that you love them.
zh: 「你甚至沒有向你的家人們道歉，你沒有告訴他們你愛他們。

en: Add that and sign it and maybe then we’re done.”
zh: 補上，簽名，然後我們就齊活了。」

en: Jerry picks up the pen.
zh: 傑瑞拿起筆。

en: Everybody is a critic, he thinks, but then realizes Hans has a point.
zh: 「每個人都是評論家。」他心想，但後來他覺得漢斯說得對。

en: He can remember writing similar letters in the past. One to Sandra, one to Eva, letters he wrote from the heart when he thought he was a killer and he thought saying good-bye was doing them a favor.
zh: 他想起過去寫過類似的信件，一份給了桑德拉，一份給了伊娃，那是他發自內心的真情流露。

en: Despite all my actions, I love my family.
zh: 儘管我選擇了這條路，但我愛我的家人。

en: I love my wife, I love my daughter, and I would do anything to have them back. Anything.
zh: 我愛我的妻子，我愛我的女兒，為了她們，我願做任何事情。

en: Eva, I’m so sorry. I love you so much.
zh: 伊娃，對不起，我愛你。

en: “There’s no emotion in here,” Hans says.
zh: 「沒有情感。」漢斯說。

en: “It’s the best I can do.”
zh: 「我只能做到這點。」

en: Hans nods. He puts down the note.
zh: 漢斯點點頭，他放下懺悔書。

en: “Here’s what I want you to do for me.
zh: 「下面是我想讓你為我做的。

en: You understand me?”
zh: 你聽懂了嗎？」

en: “I understand you.”
zh: 「聽懂了。」

en: “Put your palms flat on the desk,” Hans says.
zh: 「把你的手平放在桌子上。」漢斯說。

en: Jerry does as he’s asked.
zh: 傑瑞按他說的做。

en: He knows where this is going.
zh: 他知道這是怎麼回事。

en: He is, after all, the master of connecting the dots.
zh: 畢竟，他是把事情聯繫起來進行分析的高手。

en: In twenty seconds he’ll be dead.
zh: 二十秒后，他會死去。

en: By tomorrow he will be a confessed killer, and Eva will live with that shame, but at least she will get to live.
zh: 等到明天他將成為一個認罪的兇手，伊娃將生活在恥辱之中，但至少她會活著。

en: The Alzheimer’s has taken his life, and Sandra’s, and the women that Eric killed, but he won’t let it take Eva’s.
zh: 阿爾茨海默病已經奪去了他的生命，還有桑德拉的，以及艾瑞克殺的那些女人的，但他不會再讓它奪走伊娃的生命。

en: Hans moves around behind him, coming to a stop behind the chair.
zh: 漢斯走到他身後，在椅子後面止住腳步。

en: “Keep your left hand on the desk,” he says, “and bring your right hand up to your head.
zh: 「把你的左手放在桌子上。」他說，「把右手抬到腦袋前，假裝你的手指是把槍，你開槍打死你自己。」

en: Jerry does as he’s asked.
zh: 傑瑞按照他的要求做。

en: He brings his right hand up, turns his fingers into a barrel and points them against his skull.
zh: 他把右手舉起來，把手指變成槍筒，指向自己的頭顱。

en: His hands are shaking.
zh: 他的手在顫抖。

en: He’s thinking he should have gone for the knife. Should have done something.
zh: 他心想，剛才應該去拿刀的，這樣可以做一些事情。

en: And final words of advice?
zh: 有最後的建議嗎？

en: You’re on your own here, buddy.
zh: 「你得靠自己，夥計。」

en: Hans puts the gun into Jerry’s hand, and at the same time jams the barrel into the side of Jerry’s head.
zh: 「我知道。」漢斯把槍遞到傑瑞手裡，同時把槍管抵在傑瑞的太陽穴上。

en: He has both hands wrapped around Jerry’s hand, forcing him to maintain the aim.
zh: 他雙手緊緊抓住傑瑞的手，迫使他對準目標。

en: He closes his eyes.
zh: 他閉上眼睛。

en: He can feel his finger being forced into the trigger guard.
zh: 他可以感覺到他的手指被扳進扳機護弓里。

en: He’s doing the right thing. For Eva.
zh: 他在做正確的事情，為了伊娃。

en: But before he can do anything else, the wireless doorbell starts ringing.
zh: 但還沒等他有所動作，無線門鈴響了起來。

en: “Somebody is here,” Jerry says, searching again for a way out of this.
zh: 「有人來了。」傑瑞說，他在飛快地思考逃脫的方法，「如果有人在裏面睡覺，他們會醒來的。

en: You can’t get away with it.”
zh: 你逃不掉的。」

en: “Shut up,” Hans says, and he takes the gun out of Jerry’s hand but keeps it pointing at him.
zh: 「閉嘴。」漢斯說，他從傑瑞手裡奪過槍，指著他。

en: The doorbell keeps ringing.
zh: 門鈴仍在響。

en: “It’s probably the police,” Jerry says.
zh: 「可能是警察。」

en: “Somebody saw us break in. Maybe the owners heard us.”
zh: 傑瑞說，「有人看到我們私入民宅，也許房主聽到我們進來了。」

en: The ringing stops. There is silence for ten seconds. Then there is tapping at the office window.
zh: 鈴聲停止了，有十秒鐘的沉默，接著傳來拍打寫作房窗戶的聲音。

en: “You shoot me now,” Jerry says, “and it only makes things worse for you.”
zh: 「你現在要是開槍，」傑瑞說，「只會讓事情變得更糟。」

en: “Shut up,” Hans says, then he moves over to the curtain.
zh: 「閉嘴。」漢斯說，然後他走到窗帘旁。

en: There is more tapping, which is then followed by more silence.
zh: 拍打的聲音在持續，接著是更長時間的沉默。

en: Hans peers around the corner of the curtain, careful to keep the gun pointing in Jerry’s direction.
zh: 漢斯在窗帘的一角向外窺視，槍依然指向傑瑞。

en: “It’s your nosy neighbor,” he says.
zh: 「是你的八卦鄰居。」

en: “She’s got a flashlight and that bloody hockey stick she had earlier.
zh: 他說，「她拿著手電筒和她該死的曲棍球棒。

en: Okay, she’s leaving.
zh: 好了，她要走了。

en: Wait . . .
zh: 等等……

en: she’s moving to the back of the house.”
zh: 她走到房子的後面去了。」

en: “She’s going to come inside, and I bet she’s called the police.
zh: 「她要進來，我打賭她要叫警察。

en: You should go.”
zh: 你該走了。」

en: “She won’t be coming inside.”
zh: 「她不會進來的。」

en: “I left the key in the back door. She might.”
zh: 「我把鑰匙留在後門了，她可能會進來。」

en: Hans moves back behind the chair.
zh: 漢斯回到椅子後面。

en: He points the gun at the door.
zh: 用槍指向門口。

en: They wait.
zh: 他們等待著。

en: “Don’t shoot her,” Jerry says.
zh: 「別對她開槍。」傑瑞說。

en: “What do you care?
zh: 「你還在乎什麼？

en: You hated her anyway.”
zh: 你不是討厭她嗎？」

en: “Please.”
zh: 「求求你了。」

en: “Don’t worry, as soon as I’m done you can add a PS, I just shot the neighbor to the bottom of your confession.”
zh: 「別擔心，我殺了她以後，你可以在懺悔書後面添上一個附言：『我殺死了鄰居。』」

en: The handle on the office door starts to turn. The door opens, and there she is. Mrs. Smith, standing in the doorway wielding the hockey stick.
zh: 寫作房門上的把手轉動起來，門開了，是她——史密斯太太，她站在門口揮舞著曲棍球棒。

en: “Oh,” she says, and she must really like the sound of it because she says it again.
zh: 「哦。」她說，她一定很喜歡自己發出的那個聲音，因為她又說了一遍。

en: Any other person would be caught between fleeing and running, Jerry thinks, but not Mrs. Smith, the woman whose garden he vandalized, whose house he graffitied. Mrs. Smith who has been a constant pain in his ass since the day he moved in.
zh: 任何人遇到這種情況都會設法逃走的，傑瑞心想，但這個被他毀掉花園的女人，這個被他在房子上塗鴉的女人，這個自從他搬進來的那一天起，就一直叫嚷著屁股疼的女人，她不會的。

en: Where others might flee, or be paralyzed by shock, she comes forward, perhaps thinking she can cover the distance quick enough, perhaps thinking the man with the tattoos won’t really open fire on a woman older than the sun, perhaps thinking the very idea of a wrongdoing is so offensive she must challenge it. Hans pulls the trigger.
zh: 當別人想要逃跑，或被嚇得癱瘓時，她選擇向前進，也許她自以為她能以最快的速度穿過這段距離，也許她自以為眼前這個文身的男人不會真的對這個比太陽年紀還大的女人開火，也許她自以為漢斯冒犯了她，她必須向他挑戰。

en: It’s loud, a booming in the room that makes Jerry’s ears ring so painfully that instinct takes over and he puts both palms over his ears.
zh: 槍響了，槍聲極其響亮，在房間里震蕩，傑瑞頓時感到耳朵生疼。出於本能，他用兩隻手捂住耳朵。

en: Mrs. Smith doesn’t do that. Instead she takes two steps forward as if refusing to believe she’s been shot before coming to a stop.
zh: 但史密斯太太沒有像傑瑞那樣做，相反，她向前邁了兩步，好像不相信她會被槍擊中似的。

en: She looks down at her body where there is no sign at all of any damage, as if the bullet has gone through without harming her, or perhaps it completely missed.
zh: 她停下腳步，看著自己的身體，並沒有任何受傷的跡象，子彈似乎沒有傷到她，或者完全打偏了。

en: But then blood appears just below her chest.
zh: 但鮮血從她胸前汩汩直流。

en: She drops to her knees, her face scrunches up into a tight ball, and she uses the hockey stick to prop herself up.
zh: 她跪了下來，臉緊縮成一團，她用曲棍球棒支撐自己，奮力站了起來。

en: “How dare you,” she says.
zh: 「你怎麼敢？」她說。

en: Hans pulls the trigger again.
zh: 漢斯再次扣動扳機。

en: “What the fuck?”
zh: 「他媽的，怎麼搞的？」

en: Hans says, and Jerry knows exactly what’s happened, that when he kept spinning the chamber all those months ago as he sat next to Sandra, the bullets got out of sequence. Right now the firing pin has landed on the empty shell, the one that used to contain the bullet that killed his wife.
zh: 漢斯說，但傑瑞心裏明白是怎麼回事了，幾個月前，他坐在桑德拉身邊不停地旋轉彈筒，所有的子彈都亂了順序。

en: Hans turns the gun to the side so he can look at it, as if the problem will be visible, and as he does this Henry speaks up.
zh: 漢斯把槍偏向另一邊，所以他可以看個究竟。

en: Now, he screams, the word inside Jerry’s head almost as loud as the gunshot, so loud, in fact, that Jerry knows he too is shouting out the word.
zh: 就在這時，亨利開口說話了：「行動！」他尖叫著，那個詞撞擊著傑瑞的大腦，幾乎和槍聲一樣嘹亮。其實傑瑞知道，自己也喊出了這個詞。

en: He throws his elbow back into Hans, getting him in the base of his stomach, just as Hans pulls the trigger.
zh: 就在漢斯扣動扳機的那一剎那，他用肘部猛擊中了漢斯的腹部。

en: The shot is wide and hits the wall.
zh: 子彈打歪了，打中了牆。

en: Jerry turns in the chair and now the fight is on, and this is the way it should be done, he thinks, a fighting chance, and isn’t that the best way to end things?
zh: 傑瑞在椅子上轉過身，現在戰鬥已經開始了，這是他應該做的，他心想，一場戰鬥難道不是結束事情的最好方式？

en: It would be, except for the fact fighting is a Hans thing to do, and therefore he knows how to do it.
zh: 不過，赤手空拳的打鬥是漢斯的看家本事，他知道該如何做。不過，還有一個不容忽視的事實，那就是漢斯還有槍。

en: A gun he now turns towards Jerry.
zh: 現在，槍口再次對準了傑瑞。

en: There is another explosion of sound, and suddenly there’s a burning in his stomach and he feels like his kidneys are on fire.
zh: 又是一聲震耳欲聾的槍響，他的肚子如在灼燒一般，像是腎臟被點燃了。

en: The room darkens as his legs weaken.
zh: 他雙腿癱軟，房間里正一寸一寸變暗。

en: He’s able to get his hands onto Hans’s hand and push the gun so it’s pointing away.
zh: 他用手握住漢斯的手，把槍推開，讓它指向別處。

en: One bullet for his wife a year ago, one into Mrs. Smith, one into the wall, one into his stomach.
zh: 一年前，一發子彈射向了他妻子，一年後，一發子彈射向史密斯太太，一發射進牆壁，一發射進他的肚子。

en: That leaves two.
zh: 現在，還剩下兩發。

en: The knife, Henry says.
zh: 「刀！」亨利說，「拿起刀！

en: He can see it, but he can’t reach it. Hans is turning the gun back towards him. It’s happening in slow motion. It’s pointing at the wall, at the chair, at Jerry’s shoulder, then at his chest, and as the gun gets into position the expression on Hans’s face changes too, first one of anger, then frustration, then he smiles.
zh: 先是指向牆，再指向椅子，接著指向傑瑞的肩膀，最後對準他的胸口，隨著槍一步一步對準，漢斯臉上的表情也在變化，先是憤怒，然後是沮喪，繼而是微笑。

en: A big Fuck you smile. An I win smile.
zh: 一個「去你媽」的微笑，一個「我贏了」的微笑。

en: “Eva is next,” Hans says.
zh: 「下一個輪到伊娃。」漢斯說。

en: The hockey stick, one end still being held tightly by Mrs. Smith, swings through the air and hits Hans in the forearm, not enough power to break bone, Jerry thinks, but enough to make the gun hit the floor.
zh: 曲棍球棒，一端仍然緊緊地攥在史密斯太太手裡，在空中揮舞，擊中了漢斯的前臂，雖然力量不夠大，沒有打斷骨頭，但足以把槍擊落在地板上了。漢斯伸手去撿槍，傑瑞伸手去夠刀。

en: Hans reaches for it, and Jerry goes for the knife. He has a vision of knocking it off the desk, of it skidding over the floor, but no, his hand wraps tight around the handle.
zh: 他恍若看到它從桌子上掉落，滑到地板上了，但沒有，他的手正緊緊抓住刀柄。

en: He doesn’t hesitate. He swings it towards the man who killed his wife. He swings it as hard as he can, swings it for Sandra, for the florist, he swings it for Suzan with a z, he swings it for Eva, for everybody this man has hurt, for all of those that have had their lives ruined by their own Captain A.
zh: 他不再猶豫了，拿起刀向殺死他妻子的男人刺過去，為了桑德拉，為了花店老闆，為了蘇姍，為了伊娃，為了受到過這人傷害的每一個人，為了那些被「阿爾茨船長」毀掉的所有人。

en: Jerry puts all his strength into it, pulling forward, trying to cut all the way through to the front, but it won’t move any further.
zh: 傑瑞使出渾身的力氣，向前推，想把整個脖子切開，但切不動。

en: Not that it matters.
zh: 這已經不那麼重要了。

en: Hans stops going for the gun and puts his hand to his neck, blood shooting out like a fountain, a gurgling sound coming from deep inside his throat.
zh: 漢斯垂下拿槍的手，另一隻手捂住脖子，血液像噴泉一樣射出來，喉嚨裏面發出咕嚕咕嚕的聲音。

en: He stumbles and leans against the wall, the knife still buried all the way into his neck.
zh: 他眼睛里的光已經開始暗淡褪色，他趔趔趄趄，靠在牆上，刀仍然扎在他的脖子上。

en: Jerry reaches down for the gun. He points it at Hans.
zh: 傑瑞俯身撿起槍，指著漢斯。

en: “This is for Sandra,” he says, but before he can pull the trigger, the hockey stick comes back into view.
zh: 「這是為了桑德拉。」他說，但還沒等他扣動扳機，曲棍球棒又回到了視野之中。

en: It hits Jerry in the forehead and all the lights in the world switch off.
zh: 球棒擊中傑瑞的前額，那一瞬間，世界上所有的燈光通通熄滅。
